result.execSummary:
The defendant Tejay Allen Skordahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tejay Allen Skordahl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tejay Allen Skordahl was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County case 16CF87 and any other probation now serving.

8:49  This also includes 15CF23  Defendant Tejay Allen Skordahl in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Defendant Tejay Allen Skordahl in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Froelich addresses the court:
Amended information is filed in 16CF87 with a  charge of   Joyriding  1 yr with 3 months of conditional jail time.  Cond: what agent deems necessary  this is concurrent with the sentence in 15CF23    In  15CF23  plead to Ct 1 Uttering   Recomends  Probation 2 yrs  cond:  Restitution  $455.00  No contact Sanday Pritchard or  Patrick Smith   8 months conditional jail time    Credit of 118 days. Ct 2  will be dismissed.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. 15CFf23  Defendant pleads guitly to Ct 1 Uttering   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF23  Ct 2 is dismissed.   16CF87    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charge in the amended information  Ct 1 Joy riding.    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge in the amended information joyriding.  Court orders  on 16CF87  S/W Prob 1 year  Cond:  Court costs, DNA Sample and SC. Follow all conditions set by agent. 15CF23 S/W Probation 2 years  Concurrent with probation on 16CF87 and any other probation now serving.  Restitution $455.00.  No contact with Patrick Smith and Sandra Pritchard.  Court costs and DNA Sample and Surcharge.  3 months jail  huber is allowed. If  after completion of ST Croix Co sentence  the defendant is placed in a treatment program or a halfway house approved by the probation agent and successfully completes the program  the 3 month  jail sentence will be stayed .  The sentence on 15CF23 is concurrent to the ST Croix Co sentence now serving. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

11:37 15CF23 also heard at this time. Attorney Donald J. Schwab in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody in Pepin County, court does not need him present.  Schwab: filed for speedy trial, would like to set final pre trial and pre trial date. Continue trial from 15CF23, officer is not available until November. Court grants continuance on 15CF23, both cases set for final pre-trials and jury trials, seperately--cases are not being heard together. 11:53

10:42 a.m.  Defendant Tejay Allen Skordahl in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich -  Alleged victims are not available on trial date, State asking for continuance, Schwab has no objection, court grants motion for continuance, set new trial date and pre-trial date.  Schwab addresses court regarding bond on 16CF87. Currently $2500.00 cash bond. Schwab requesting signature bond on 16CF87, in the alternative amend 15CF23 to cash bond so defendant gets credit for time served.  Froelich, no objection to amending to cash bond on 15CF23.  Court orders $10,000 signature bond on 16CF87 conditional on verified proof of a bed at halfway house.  $2500 cash bond to remain until verification of bed at halfway house.  If Defendant leaves halfway house bond goes back to $2500 cash bond.
